description: A program that defines some basic values.
grammar:
expr ::= base
       | "let" "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*" target ";" expr

target ::= ":" "T[0-9]+" "=" expr

base ::= "~" "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*" base
       | "@"

description: A program that defines a function that takes a list and returns its length.
grammar:
expr ::= base
       | base argchain
       | "let" "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*" target ";" expr
       | "fix" "(" expr ")"

target ::= ":" "T[0-9]+" "=" expr

basepat ::= "(" pattern ")"
          | "@"
          | "~" "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*" basepat
          | "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*"

base ::= function
       | argchain
       | "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*"
       | "~" "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*" base
       | "@"

pattern ::= basepat
          | basepat "," pattern

function ::= "case" pattern "=>" expr
           | "case" pattern "=>" expr function

argchain ::= "(" expr ")"

description: A program that defines a function that takes a boolean and a list and returns its length or the list paired with its length.
grammar:
expr ::= base
       | base argchain
       | "let" "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*" target ";" expr
       | "if" expr "then" expr "else" expr
       | base "," expr
       | "fix" "(" expr ")"

target ::= ":" "T[0-9]+" "=" expr

basepat ::= "(" pattern ")"
          | "@"
          | "~" "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*" basepat
          | "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*"

base ::= function
       | argchain
       | "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*"
       | "~" "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*" base
       | "@"

pattern ::= basepat
          | basepat "," pattern

argchain ::= "(" expr ")" argchain
           | "(" expr ")"

function ::= "case" pattern "=>" expr
           | "case" pattern "=>" expr function

description: A program that defines construction of a pair by calling two different functions on the same input.
grammar:
expr ::= base
       | "let" "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*" target ";" expr
       | base "," expr

target ::= ":" "T[0-9]+" "=" expr

basepat ::= "(" pattern ")"
          | recpat
          | "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*"

base ::= function
       | argchain
       | "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*"
       | "@"

pattern ::= basepat

argchain ::= "(" expr ")" argchain
           | "(" expr ")"

recpat ::= "_." "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*" "=" pattern

function ::= "case" pattern "=>" expr

expr ::= base
       | base argchain
       | "let" "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*" target ";" expr
       | "fix" "(" expr ")"
       | base "," expr

target ::= ":" "T[0-9]+" "=" expr

basepat ::= "(" pattern ")"
          | "@"
          | "~" "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*" basepat
          | "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*"

base ::= function
       | "~" "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*" base
       | argchain
       | "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*"
       | "@"

pattern ::= basepat
          | basepat "," pattern

function ::= "case" pattern "=>" expr
           | "case" pattern "=>" expr function

argchain ::= "(" expr ")"

description: A program that defines less-than-or-equal of two numbers and maximum of two numbers.
grammar:
expr ::= base
       | base argchain
       | "let" "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*" target ";" expr
       | "if" expr "then" expr "else" expr
       | "fix" "(" expr ")"
       | base "," expr

target ::= ":" "T[0-9]+" "=" expr

basepat ::= "(" pattern ")"
          | "@"
          | "~" "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*" basepat
          | "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*"

base ::= function
       | argchain
       | "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*"
       | "~" "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*" base
       | "@"

pattern ::= basepat
          | basepat "," pattern

argchain ::= "(" expr ")" argchain
           | "(" expr ")"

function ::= "case" pattern "=>" expr
           | "case" pattern "=>" expr function

description: A program that defines addition and multiplication.
grammar:
expr ::= base
       | base argchain
       | "let" "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*" target ";" expr
       | "fix" "(" expr ")"
       | base "," expr

target ::= ":" "T[0-9]+" "=" expr

basepat ::= "(" pattern ")"
          | "@"
          | "~" "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*" basepat
          | "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*"

base ::= function
       | "~" "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*" base
       | argchain
       | "[a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z]*"
       | "@"

pattern ::= basepat
          | basepat "," pattern

argchain ::= "(" expr ")" argchain
           | "(" expr ")"

function ::= "case" pattern "=>" expr
           | "case" pattern "=>" expr function
